unnormalised: **Entertainment: Bollywood's Box Office Blues (and Biryani Dreams)**
normalised: **Entertainment: Bollywood's Box Office Blues (and Biryani Dreams)**

unnormalised: Bollywood's churn continues! This week saw 3 big releases vying for your hard-earned Rs. 300. First, "Desi Avengers: Chapati Chaos," starring Arjun Kapoor as a particularly grumpy Hawkeye. Critics called it "longer than the line for biryani at a wedding."
normalised: Bollywood's churn continues! This week saw three big releases vying for your hard-earned rupee three hundred. First, "Desi Avengers: Chapati Chaos," starring Arjun Kapoor as a particularly grumpy Hawkeye. Critics called it "longer than the line for biryani at a wedding."

unnormalised: Then there’s "Sharmaji's Space Adventures," a surprisingly serious film about a retired accountant who accidentally launches himself into orbit. Early reviews are promising, but "will it beat 'Pathaan'?" asked one overly enthusiastic Twitter user.
normalised: Then there’s "Sharmaji's Space Adventures," a surprisingly serious film about a retired accountant who accidentally launches himself into orbit. Early reviews are promising, but "will it beat 'Pathaan'?" asked one overly enthusiastic Twitter user.

unnormalised: Finally, "Onam Under Attack," a disaster flick featuring rogue elephants and a misplaced Onam Sadhya. Initial reports suggest viewers are more likely to laugh than cry, especially during the scene where the elephants trip over 500 km of marigold garlands.
normalised: Finally, "Onam Under Attack," a disaster flick featuring rogue elephants and a misplaced Onam Sadhya. Initial reports suggest viewers are more likely to laugh than cry, especially during the scene where the elephants trip over five hundred kilometer of marigold garlands.

unnormalised: Box office analysts are predicting a mixed bag. Will any film truly conquer the hearts of the janta, or will everyone just re-watch "3 Idiots" again? Only time (and next Friday's releases) will tell. Fingers crossed for some actual entertainment!
normalised: Box office analysts are predicting a mixed bag. Will any film truly conquer the hearts of the janta, or will everyone just re-watch "three Idiots" again? Only time (and next Friday's releases) will tell. Fingers crossed for some actual entertainment!
